intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris var. vulgaris, commonly known as shepherd's purse, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods that resemble a purse, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm and has alternate, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It produces small white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring, followed by the development of its unique seed pods. This plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a common weed in agricultural fields.
